resources.string: From GCM: server deleted %1$d pending messages!
Trying (attempt %1$d/%2$d) to register device on CoPA Server.
From CoPA Server: successfully added device!
From Demo Server: successfully removed device!
Could not register device on CoPA Server after %1$d attempts.
Could not unregister device on CoPA Server (%1$s).
Device is already registered on server.
Please set the %1$s constant and recompile the app.
CoPA stands for Change of Plan Application.
There are no coming events subscribed. \n Use the search to find your events and subscribe them.
List of all rightholders, deputies and owners
Hello, this is the first time you meet CoPA.

All of the privileges "Owner", "Deputy", "Rightholder" belong to an event. So you can have a privilege for an specified event. Depending an which privilege you got, you can do different things:

 Owner 
An owner is chosen by the CoPA-System or appointed by an admin.
As a owner you can appoint and remove deputies and rightholders on the CoPA-Website. The following works from the CoPA-App and CoPA-Website: A owner can change dates of his event and see the other owners, deputies and rightholders. 
For an owner it is not possible to remove his privilege to be an owner.

 Deputy
A deputy is appointed by an owner of an event. 
As a deputy you can discard your privileges or appoint and remove rightholders on the CoPA-Website.The following works from the CoPA-App and CoPA-Website: A deputy can also see all owners, deputies and rightholders of his event and change dates of his event. 

 Rightholder
A rightholder is appointed by an owner or a deputy of an event.
As a rightholder you can discard your privileges on the CoPA-Website.You can also change dates with the CoPA-App or on the -Website and see all owners, deputies and rightholders.But a rightholder has no chance to appoint anyone.

These are all functionalities that are useable with the CoPA-App:

 Login
 Just use your uni-login-data to authenticate.You can reach the loginpage with the "Menu"-button for example on the startpage if you are not logged in.

 Logout
 You can reach the logoutpage with the "Menu"-button on the startpage if you are logged in.

 Search
 The search is reachable with the "Menu"-button for example on the startpage if you are logged in. Just click throw the categories and enter a searchterm. Your request will automatically start if there are no following categories pickable.

 Subscribe
 Use the search to find the event you want to subscribe. Then click the "subscribe"-button. You need to be logged in for this. After you have successfully subscribed an event you will be informed about changes of dates that belong to it. How you will be informed belongs on your chosen settings.

 Unsubscribe
 To unsubscribe an event find it in the list of your subscribed events(look at "see subscribed events") and click the button "unsubscribe" if you are logged in. You will be no longer informed about changes that belong to this event.

 Get updates
 Depending on your chosen settings you will be automatically informed about changes or you have to use the "refresh"-button on the startpage. For more details have a look at "Possible settings".

 See subscribed events
 With a click on the "Menu"-button you can select "Subscribed events" and see all events for which you get updates.

 See an informationtext from an event
 Just search(look at "search") the event that you are interested in and click on "info".

 See events with privileges
 With a click on the "Menu"-button you can select "privileges" and see all events for which you have privileges.

 See owners,deputies and rightholders of an event
 You can only see them if you have privileges for this event. Use the "Menu"-button to switch to the list of events with privileges and click on "privileged".

 Change date of an event
 Find the date you want to change for example by clicking on the event to which it belongs to this date. Then enter your changes and click on "Apply" to change this date.

 Change color of an event
 Use your list of subscribed events (look at "See subscribed events") and click on the button "color" to select one.

 Change e-mail-/CoPA-Website-language
 Click on "Settings" in the menu that opens by pressing the "Menu"-button and use the "save" button to confirm your changes. This will set the language for the CoPA-Website and e-mails. For details about the possibilities look at "Possible settings".

 Change kind of notification
 Click on "Settings" in the menu that opens by pressing the "Menu"-button and use the "save" button to confirm your changes. This will choose the way on which you are informed. For details about the possibilities look at "Possible settings".

 
These functionalities are only reachable from the CoPA-Website:
 Discard a privilege
 You can give up your privileges if you are not a owner. For this use the CoPA-Website.

 Appoint or remove deputies/rightholders
 Depending on your privilege(look at"About privileges") you can delegate or remove privileges to another person. For this use the CoPA-Website.

Language
 E-mail and CoPA-Website:
 In the settings you can choose between english and german. This will be the language in which the e-mails that you receive will be written if you selected e-mail as notification.
 Also the CoPA-Website will have this language if you are logged in.

 CoPA-App
 The CoPA-App can be used two languages: english and german. It will automatically be set on the android-system-language. If the system-language is either english or german the app will use english. To change the app-language use your system-settings.

 Kind of notification
 E-mail
 If you allow e-mail-notification an e-mail will automatically be send to you if one of your subscribed events is changed. This will use your uni e-mail adress.

 Push automatic
 If you use this option you will receive a message if any date of a subscribed event changes and the change will be automatically send to your decive. Of course you can just receive the message or the change if you got an internet connection.

 Push manual
 If you use this option you will receive a message if any date of a subscribed event changes but the change will not be automatically send to your decive. To get the update you need to click "refresh" on the startpage. Of course you can just receive the message if you got an internet connection.

 Manual
 If you use this option you will not receive a message if any date of a subscribed event changes. You need to click "refresh" on the startpage to get informed about changes.

ClientProtocolException
 APIException
 Indicates an error caused by inappropriate API usage.

 PermissionException
 Indicates a rejection of a request by the service because of insufficient permission.

 RequestNotPracticableException
 Indicates that a request could not be executed because of its parameterization.

 InternalErrorException
 Indicates an internal error at the service.

 IOException
This will remove all stored events from your device.\n Enter new UserName:
